channel.title: Linux on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Notes

item.title: How to monitor amount of data transferred over a specific port
What command hides behind alias?
item.description: To check what command is assigned to the alias use type command: $ type gl gl is aliased to `git log --oneline'

item.title: CPU benchmark
item.description: CPU benchmark from Dell Precision 15 5510 Core-i5 i5-6440HQ $ sysbench cpu run --time=5 sysbench 1.0.9 (using system LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3) Running the test with following options: Number of threads: 1 Initializing random number generator from current time Prime numbers limit: 10000 Initializing worker threads... Threads started! CPU speed: events per second: 1157.88 General statistics: total time: 5.0008s total number of events: 5792 Latency (ms): min: 0.80 avg: 0.86 max: 3.74 95th percentile: 1.

item.title: List all IP addresses in a network
item.description: To list ip addresses of all connected to the network devices, use this command: nmap -sn 192.

item.title: Install flashplayer in Firefox
item.description: I have flashplayer installed on my system from the official Adobe repository, but Firefox for some reason does not have flash plugin installed. You can check if your browser supports flash by navigating to this url To make Firefox aware of flashplugin, try to create a symlink here: cd http://isflashinstalled.com/ && ln -s /usr/lib64/flash-plugin/libflashplayer.so .

item.title: Monitor process with top
item.description: One liner to monitor a process with the name /wshub: top -p "$(pgrep -f /wshub)"

item.title: Run command as a different user
item.description: Command runuser allows to run a command as a different user. You must be root to be able to run that command: sudo runuser -l vagrant -c "GH=1 env"

item.title: Monitor cpu and memory usage of the process
item.description: Print every second cpu and memory usage of the process: watch -n 1 "ps -eo pid,pcpu,pmem,args | kazy -i xnotitle -e kazy"
